name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
I originally thought that such a low-level rumor was unnecessary to be refuted.
But I didn't expect that someone would still believe it. It's really annoying.
I can only take up everyone's time here.
This matter is actually very simple.
First, if I charged the contributors, it would not have been exposed until today.
Second, I deal with so many contributions every day. If I can collect money from this, then I don't have to raise money when something happens.
Third, the biggest flaw in this lie is that many Twitter friends have said that Chinese Paypal accounts cannot donate to my donation link.
So this is a fake picture that is completely fictitious.
The above is the response to this matter. I think everyone should be able to understand it very easily.
The following is what I say to all the Twitter friends who support me:
In the past period of time, I have experienced a series of behaviors such as impersonating accounts, a large number of reports, water army flooding, slandering me for collecting contribution fees, and impersonating me to send private messages.
Today, six months later, I am exhausted in reality, and I am always on the edge of the vortex on the Internet. But few people know that six months ago I was just an ordinary person who just graduated from school.
I have no idea what the future holds, but because of your tolerance, support and encouragement, I believe I can do more and better for you.
Thank you all.
Neither you nor I will fall.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Chinese warships at the scene of the evacuation of Chinese nationals from Sudan.
According to relevant information, more than 1,100 Chinese have been safely evacuated from Sudan so far.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
A 24-year-old female worker in Shanghai died suddenly. Her husband said that she worked 12 hours a day on the night shift and 323 hours in March.
The company said that it did not force overtime and the female worker "voluntarily worked overtime."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Attention! 
Netizens who have contributed to my work please do not, do not, do not, help me prove my innocence under this tweet. Protect yourself and do not trust any unsolicited private messages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @BitRunX, quit the circle but don't quit your account. I won't talk about those things anymore. I really want to hear you talk about AI.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On April 27, according to a "2023 Global Happiness Index Report" involving 32 countries, 91% of Chinese people consider themselves "very or very happy", ranking first in the world's "happiest country".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Today, Phoenix.com published a news story about a 38-year-old master's degree holder who became a food deliveryman after losing his job.
However, in the article, the word "epidemic" was replaced with "mask", which triggered a discussion among netizens. Everyone was surprised that as a well-known large domestic media, they dared not say the word "epidemic" directly.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
According to netizens, crosstalk artist Cao Yunjin also used "three years of masks" to replace "three years of epidemic" in a Douyin live broadcast.
It is possible that using "masks" to replace "epidemic" is a general requirement for major online platforms, not an accident.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
April 27, Shanghai Pudong
The giant panda Yaya, who has been the focus of attention in recent days, returned to China on a special plane. Some people who came to pick her up cried heartbreakingly after seeing the plane.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @Azhi_zzzz Didn't the princess go home a long time ago?
